title: Johan de Aguas
text:
I’m completing my PhD degree at the Faculty of Mathematics and Natural Sciences (MatNat) at the University of Oslo (UiO), under the supervision of Dr. Johan Pensar. Additionally, I hold a research position at the Norwegian Institute of Public Health (NIPH), where I work under the guidance of Dr. Guido Biele.
My research focuses on integrating causal inference with machine learning models to develop robust, scalable and reliable algorithms that enable decision-making across complex data environments. My PhD work uncovers pathways for identification, partial identification, recovery, robust estimation and stable inference for causal and counterfactual queries in systems affected by preferential selection mechanisms. I apply these methods to assess the impact of ADHD treatment on school performance using observational data.
I hold undergraduate degrees in industrial engineering and economics from Universidad de los Andes (UniAndes) in Colombia. Moreover, I earned master’s degrees in economics and statistics, the latter from Michigan State University (MSU), where I was an international Fulbright scholar.
I have professional experience as a research consultant and lead data scientist, where I contributed to projects in areas such as impact evaluation, regional competitiveness, international trade, mobile banking, and alternative credit scoring.

title: Johan de Aguas
text:
Research
My research interests and experience include:

Leveraging graphical criteria to recover causal queries in settings with selection mechanisms
Constructing partial identification strategies for counterfactual benefit parameters with ordered tiered outcomes
Developing multiply-robust and efficient estimation procedures grounded in semiparametric theory
Integrating insights from econometrics, game theory, statistics, and network science to offer new perspectives for motivated applications

title: Johan de Aguas
text:
Career

2021 - Now: Researcher at the Norwegian Institute of Public Health (NIPH)
2020 - 2021: Consultant (promoted from Summer Intern) at the Inter-American Development Bank (IADB)
2018 - 2020: Lead Data Scientist (promoted from Data Scientist) at Tpaga (startup)
2014 - 2017: Research Consultant at the Economic Commission for Latin America and the Caribbean (ECLAC)

title: Johan de Aguas
text:
Scholarships and grants

2023: Germany exchange program with the Helmholtz Information & Data Science Academy (HIDA) — Norwegian Artificial Intelligence Research Consortium - NORA
2019 - 2021: International Fulbright scholar program — United States Department of State
2015-2018: High-level human capital training program for the regions — Ministry of Science, Technology and Innovation of Colombia
2008-2012: Quiero Estudiar scholarship program — Universidad de los Andes
